prompt: <description>**Instructions for Part 1: Creating a Tapered Rectangular Prism with a Cylindrical Hole** **Part 1: Create a new coordinate system** 1. Define the euler angles as [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] degrees. 2. Set the translation vector as [0.0, 0.7485, 0.0]. **Part 1: Create the 2D sketch** 1. Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 2. Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.7485, 0.0]. 3. Draw an arc with a center point at [0.6495, 0.2752], starting from point [0.7485, 0.0], and ending at point [0.3742, 0.3742]. 4. Draw a line from point [0.3742, 0.3742] to point [0.3742, 0.7485]. 5. Draw a line from point [0.3742, 0.7485] to point [0.0, 0.7485]. 6. Close the loop by drawing a line from point [0.0, 0.7485] to point [0.0, 0.0]. **Part 1: Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch** 1. Apply the euler angles and translation vector to the 2D sketch to transform it into a 3D sketch. **Part 1: Extrude the 3D sketch** 1. Extrude the 3D sketch by a depth of 0.7485 units towards the normal of the sketch plane. 2. Scale the sketched shape by a factor of 0.7485. 3. Create a new solid body as the result of the extrusion. Please note that these instructions refer to the final shape described in the JSON and do not include any additional assumptions. The resulting CAD model will be a tapered rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole, where the height, width, and length of the prism and the diameter of the hole are defined by the given JSON.</description>
